attributes.action: Strippers Demand The Return Of The £1 Note
attributes.additional_details:
With the economy today, Lap Dancing Venues, Strip Clubs, Gentlemen's Clubs are not quite what they used to be. In America performers make up their income by the form of the "Tipping Rail" where patrons could place 'dollar bills', in some cases the club would "Make It Rain" with dollars being thrown at the stage sometimes in black bin bags. In the UK this would be more like large hail stones or some cases a stoning as £1 and £2 coins would be thrown at the stage if the practice was duplicated. UK customers at best do not like to tip, so leaving a £5 note is a figure that exceeds an acceptable figure.

Please lets help the dancers of Great Britain and make them feel great again and bring back the £1 'note' as every little helps.

rejection.details: The day-to-day arrangements for printing, issue and circulation of banknotes are the responsibility of the Bank of England
